author: admin
title: Data Reveals Why Cannabis Users Tend To Be Thinner - The Art Of MaryJane Media
text: [American Journal of Medicine](https://theartofmaryjanemedia.com/category/american-journal-of-medicine/) Data Reveals Why Cannabis Users Tend To Be Thinner With the stigma of “the munchies” people have been a bit baffled marijuana consumers tend to be a bit thinner! Unlike other vices, it seems marijuana may have another benefit – helping keep off the weight. Despite “ [the munchies](https://thefreshtoast.com/rx/marijuana-users-gain-less-weight-than-non-users/)” or an increased appetite, it seems it doesn’t matter. Although it may seem intuitive that an increased appetite would lead to weight gain, current existing epidemiological studies suggest that marijuana users are less likely to have obesity. Now data reveals why cannabis users tend to be thinner One theory is cannabis can influence a person’s level of insulin, thus, influencing their waistline. [One study](https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2013/05/study-why-pot-smokers-are-skinnier/275846/), published in the American Journal of Medicine, collected and analyzed data from 4,600 adults. RELATED: [Science Says Medical Marijuana Improves Quality Of Life](https://thefreshtoast.com/cannabis/science-says-medical-marijuana-improves-quality-of-life/) Researchers found that current marijuana users had significantly smaller waistlines when compared to participants who had never smoked marijuana before. These results were surprising since factors like gender, age, tobacco and alcohol use, physical activity and more were considered. Participants who consumed cannabis had lower levels of insulin when compared to those who didn’t consume marijuana. Even people who had consumed cannabis in the past had lower insulin levels than the average person, although to much smaller degrees. RELATED: [Federal Study Aims To Learn More About Marijuana And Weight Loss](https://thefreshtoast.com/cannabis/federal-study-aims-to-learn-more-about-marijuana-and-weight-loss/) [Another factor that can influence people’s weight is THCV](https://thefreshtoast.com/cannabis/thcv-powerful-appetite-suppressing-cannabinoid/), a cannabinoid with appetite suppressant effects. Despite THCV being a minor cannabinoid and there being much less information out there on its effects, the compound is known for blocking out THC’s powerful hunger inducing capabilities, which could help some people manage their eating patterns and behaviors. Although there are currently no medications or ways of consuming THCV directly, there are a few strains that contain high amounts of the compound, especially in sativa dominant strains. Durban Poison, Girl Scout Cookies, Cherry Pie, Face off OG, and others could be an interesting choice if you want to check out the effects of THCV for yourself. Leave a Reply [Cancel reply](/data-reveals-why-cannabis-users-tend-to-be-thinner/#respond) Leave a Reply [American Journal of Medicine](https://theartofmaryjanemedia.com/category/american-journal-of-medicine/) Data Reveals Why Cannabis Users To Be Skinner With the stigma of “the munchies” people have been a bit baffled marijuana consumers tend to be a bit thinner! Unlike other vices, it seems marijuana may have another benefit – helping keep off the weight. Despite “ [the munchies](https://thefreshtoast.com/rx/marijuana-users-gain-less-weight-than-non-users/)” or an increased appetite, it seems it doesn’t matter. Although it may seem intuitive that an increased appetite would lead to weight gain, current existing epidemiological studies suggest that marijuana users are less likely to have obesity. One theory is cannabis can influence a person’s level of insulin, thus, influencing their waistline. [One study](https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2013/05/study-why-pot-smokers-are-skinnier/275846/), published in the American Journal of Medicine, collected and analyzed data from 4,600 adults. RELATED: [Science Says Medical Marijuana Improves Quality Of Life](https://thefreshtoast.com/cannabis/science-says-medical-marijuana-improves-quality-of-life/) Researchers found that current marijuana users had significantly smaller waistlines when compared to participants who had never smoked marijuana before. These results were surprising since factors like gender, age, tobacco and alcohol use, physical activity and more were considered. Participants who consumed cannabis had lower levels of insulin when compared to those who didn’t consume marijuana. Even people who had consumed cannabis in the past had lower insulin levels than the average person, although to much smaller degrees. RELATED: [Federal Study Aims To Learn More About Marijuana And Weight Loss](https://thefreshtoast.com/cannabis/federal-study-aims-to-learn-more-about-marijuana-and-weight-loss/) [Another factor that can influence people’s weight is THCV](https://thefreshtoast.com/cannabis/thcv-powerful-appetite-suppressing-cannabinoid/), a cannabinoid with appetite suppressant effects. Despite THCV being a minor cannabinoid and there being much less information out there on its effects, the compound is known for blocking out THC’s powerful hunger inducing capabilities, which could help some people manage their eating patterns and behaviors. Although there are currently no medications or ways of consuming THCV directly, there are a few strains that contain high amounts of the compound, especially in sativa dominant strains. Durban Poison, Girl Scout Cookies, Cherry Pie, Face off OG, and others could be an interesting choice if you want to check out the effects of THCV for yourself. [American Journal of Medicine](https://theartofmaryjanemedia.com/category/american-journal-of-medicine/) Is Marijuana Use Linked With An Overactive Bladder? Marijuana has gone mainstream and become part of people’s weekly life. Similar to alcohol, it is even moving into people’s routine. We know how beer makes you want to visit the restroom, but what about cannabis. It seems heavy use of marijuana might be linked with an overactive bladder. Overactive bladder is defined as a condition where people have to urinate with more frequency. It includes behaviors like nocturia, urge incontinence, and more. It’s considered a chronic disease. At worse it is a major inconvenience and can cause disrupted sleep, but it can lead to other conditions. It [affects up to 33 million adults](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/diseases/14248-overactive-bladder#:~:text=How%20common%20is%20overactive%20bladder,and%20won%27t%20get%20help.), including as many as 30% of men and 40% of women. However, that number may be higher because many people may feel embarrassed and won’t get help. A [study](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0002934322006672) published in the American Journal of Medicine examined whether marijuana has an impact on overactive bladders and found regular marijuana consumers are more likely to suffer from the condition than non-users. Researchers collected data from 2005 and 2018 on regular and non-regular marijuana users aged 18 to 59, who answered a variety of questions about drug use and kidney conditions. RELATED: [Study: Regular Cannabis Use Not Linked To Anhedonia (What Is Anhedonia?)](https://thefreshtoast.com/news/study-regular-cannabis-use-not-linked-to-anhedonia-what-is-anhedonia/) Over 18,000 samples were gathered, with 24% of respondents identifying as regular marijuana users. These people were more likely to be male, single, smokers, thinner, and younger when compared to the other participants in the study. They also reported more urinary incontinence and frequent nocturia, which is the urge to wake up in the middle of the night to go use the bathroom. While researchers don’t fully understand why marijuana affects bladders specifically, the study shows regular marijuana users were at higher risk of overactive bladder disorder and are especially at higher risk of [nocturia](https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/diseases/14510-nocturia). “Our data do not support the evidence for the use of cannabinoids in the medical treatment of patients with overactive bladder, especially given the thorny health problems caused by marijuana,” concludes the study. RELATED: [The Incredible Truth About Marijuana And Bladder Cancer](https://thefreshtoast.com/cannabis/the-incredible-truth-about-marijuana-and-bladder-cancer-2/) Before you becoming overly concerned about marijuana, there are multiple causes for an overactive bladder. They include drinking too much fluid, [urinary tract infections (UTIs)](https://www.healthline.com/health/urinary-tract-infection-adults), caffeinated drinks, alcohol, spicy foods, and other [bladder irritants](https://www.healthline.com/health/11-foods-to-avoid-if-you-have-oab), and having certain health conditions, for example, [bladder stones](https://www.healthline.com/health/bladder-stones) or [diabetes](https://www.healthline.com/health/diabetes). In addition, certain medications can lead to the same condition, so if they are issues, chat with your doctor. author: STAFF/Okanagan Newspaper Group
title: Similkameen Sizzle Festival this weekend
text: KEREMEOS — Canada’s only hot pepper festival is back this weekend at Memorial Park in Keremeos. If you like your food spicy and enjoy good family fun, the annual Similkameen Sizzle Festival is back on Saturday, Sept. 21 and hotter than ever. This isn’t just any hot pepper festival, it’s Canada’s only hot pepper festival and it’s all going down in charming Keremeos. Organizers are telling anyone who might want to attend for the first time to not let the small-town vibes fool you, as the Similkameen Sizzle promises big flavours and even bigger fun. Attendees can shop till they drop at the Sizzle market, which will be selling artisanal goodies to the freshest produce from local agricultural lands. There will be plenty of live music all day and evening as there will be classic rocks bands performing throughout the day. The Kids’ Zone will keep the little ones happy with entertainment, games and a bouncy castle. The highlight of the festival will be the infamous “Sear Factor” Hot Pepper Eating Contest. Registration takes place throughout the day and you must be at least 18 years of age to sign up. For all the hot sauce maestros out there, the Hot Sauce Battle also returns. Sign-up forms for the hot sauce contest will be available on site. There will also be a licensed adult beverage area, where you can sip on local wines, beers and ciders. For more information, visit: [similkameencountry.org](http://similkameencountry.org/)

author: José Antonio Romero Santiago
title: Gatito que buscaba comida terminó por encontrar una familia - UnoTV
text: Oye, [¿aparecen gatos en tu casa?](https://www.unotv.com/mascotas/gatos/los-gatos-llegan-a-tu-casa-sin-razon-aparente-ni-invitacion-aqui-te-explicamos-los-motivos/) Pues pon mucha atención, ya que ya sea que tu respuesta sea si o no, hoy te daremos un ejemplo con el que podrías cambiarle la vida a un michi. Un gatito termina por encontrar una familia, justo en el momento que más lo necesitaba, pues debido a la falta de un dueño o amigo humano, llegó a un hogar buscando comida, pero al notar que estaba más físicamente, unas personas decidieron ayudarle. ¿Quién es el gatito que buscaba comida terminó siendo adoptado? Esta historia se originó pocas semanas atrás en New Jersey, Estados Unidos, donde Bowie (un pequeño michi) llegó inesperadamente al hogar de una familia, y al verlo con mucha hambre y flaco, así como mal olor, decidieron poner manos en acción y darle la asistencia que requería. También te podría interesar: [[Gatito se mete en cesto de regalos para poder conseguir una familia, lo más tierno que verás]](https://www.unotv.com/mascotas/gatos/gatito-se-mete-en-cesto-de-regalos-para-poder-conseguir-una-familia-lo-mas-tierno-que-veras/) Luego de alimentarlo decidieron llevarlo refugio animal Community Cat Club, donde algunos especialistas lo evaluaron y tuvieron que curarle algunas heridas. Al inspeccionarlo a fondo también notaron que no portaba placa o microchip, por lo que se dedujo que no tenía dueño. Fue precisamente en este refugio donde se decidió nombrarlo como Bowie, ya que al comenzar a ser tratado, y responder positivamente, comenzó a mostrar su simpatía. Te podría interesar leer: [[Gato regresa a casa con bolsa llena de dinero y su dueña no tiene idea de dónde salió]](https://www.unotv.com/mascotas/gatos/gato-regresa-a-casa-con-bolsa-llena-de-dinero-y-su-duena-no-tiene-idea-de-donde-salio/) El primer ángel que llegó a la vida de Bowie Luego de ser tratado en el Community Cat Club, se optó por encontrar un hogar para Bowie, y mientras eso sucedía se le envió a un lugar de acogida, donde Michelle Rauh lo recibió con mucho gusto y en Facebook también ayudó a promoverlo “Busca un hogar que lo trate como a un príncipe mimado. Tenga en cuenta que los gatos de pelo largo requieren un aseo profesional ocasional en sus zonas sanitarias y un cepillado semanal. Parece haber sido criado con perros y tiene mucha confianza en la gente.” La adopción llegó Así, la historia de un gatito que termina por encontrar una familia cuando buscaba comida llegó a un final feliz, pues el mismo refugio animal compartió “Bowie fue adoptado hace una semana y claramente se ha adaptado bien. ¡Nos encantan las actualizaciones sobre adopción!” De esta manera, nuestro pequeño michi (de pelaje blanco y negro) encontró a una humana que ahora lo trata con cariño y respeto:
